column4: and guys, after I install nVidia drivers on my Dell XPS 15, it starts only with the CLI. It needs me to boot using failsafe mode and then delete the xorg.conf file. Performing nvidia-xconfig doesn't help either. Any fix?
so will it run X yes or no
like try  xinit from the command line
it does not run X after installing the driver, it requires me to delete xorg.conf files
and so it gets back to integrated intel hd gfx
did you delete xorg.conf?
yes there is no other way.. even reconfiguring the file and restarting the X server doesnt work
so you have a native adapter and an nvidia adapter?
yes.. my laptop has integrated intel hd gfx and nvidia gpu
I believe this has something to do with the new nVidia Optimus which switches from integrated gfx to nVidia whenever it needs (it works fine on windows)
that makes little sense.   laptops dont have both very often.    If you do    lspci -v   | grep -i nvidia   do you see anything?
it switches driving the native LCD?
did the driver install correctly?
i've not connected any external display to my laptop.. so it switches between each other and displays on the same inbuilt display on laptop
the driver has been installed correctly, but there is some issue with the configuration

I have heard of the switching.    But I dont know how to do it linux.   I would check in bios and see if there is a way to force it to be nvidia all the time.    Try to boot up in  non-graphics mode.    safe vga mode or whatever.
http://www.nvidia.com/object/optimus_technology.html
I tried that in bios, but there is no option to set nvidia to default.. but in windows, in nvidia setup tool there is an option to set the nvidia gpu as default
I would try to make sure that linux is in plain text console mode until  its ready to run full X.    Try to turn off all bootsplash stuff.
try to stay non-graphics until the last second and then fire up the nvidia drivers.
ok.. i will try
thank you!
good luck
